overview.short: Elizabethkingia meningoseptica is a Gram-negative, aerobic, non-fermenting, non-motile rod historically associated with neonatal meningitis and healthcare-associated infections.
overview.clinical_context: Classically linked to neonatal meningitis outbreaks and severe infections in immunocompromised patients; now recognised as part of a complex requiring advanced identification methods.

species_markers.notes: Historically associated with neonatal meningitis outbreaks, though modern identification often reassigns isolates to E. anophelis.
Supports Elizabethkingia genus but is not species-definitive.

common_confusions.reason: Frequently misidentified historically as E. meningoseptica due to database limitations.
Related flavobacteria with overlapping phenotypic profiles.

when_to_question_identification: Species assignment based solely on biochemical testing.
Absence of neonatal or outbreak context in clinical history.
Identification not confirmed by MALDI-TOF MS or sequencing.

recommended_next_tests.reason: Essential for accurate discrimination within the Elizabethkingia complex.
Gold-standard confirmation when MALDI databases are limited.
